July 4th from Europe: “Oh, it’s home again, and home again, America for me! I want a ship that’s westward bound to plough the rolling sea,
To the blesséd Land of Room Enough beyond the ocean bars,
Where the air is full of sunlight and the flag is full of stars.” - Henry Van Dyke

Our bipartisan, bicameral delegation was greeted warmly by Finland’s President in Turku this morning with homegrown rhubarb juice. We thanked President Niinisto for Finland’s strong and enduring friendship with the United States. We’re thankful for such wonderful allies. https://t.co/jxmjkK0DAJ
Again, nobody wins trade wars https://t.co/pT8Svz1pQk

FINALLY, Senate will push back on the President’s abuse of Section 232 to impose tariffs. We will vote Wednesday on a “Motion to Instruct,” a first step toward reasserting Congress’s constitutional role on tariffs.
By a vote of 88-11, the senate just took the first step to rein in the President’s abuse of trade authority by using national security as justification to levy tariffs.

When we were attacked on 9/11, our NATO allies rushed to our defense. They have remained stedfast ever since, sacrificing thousands of lives in Afghanistan over these many years to keep us safe. I hope they know how much we appreciate their commitment and friendship.
At approximate 2:00pm EDT I will deliver a senate floor speech titled Friends, Foes & Peace
My thoughts on the upcoming meeting between President Trump and Vladimir Putin https://t.co/UZD8HCundr
Mr. President, as today’s indictments reaffirm, election interference is not a question to be asked of Vladimir Putin, but a statement to be made to Vladimir Putin: You interfered in our elections.
I never thought I would see the day when our American President would stand on the stage with the Russian President and place blame on the United States for Russian aggression. This is shameful.
What am I doing, this pig can’t even read. https://t.co/Bi3PEAG25S

Just intro’d a resolution with @ChrisCoons reaffirming Senate support for the Intel Community’s assessment of Russian attacks and dismissing the denial of Vladimir Putin. Tomorrow on the Senate floor we will ask for unanimous consent to pass it.  
https://t.co/2b2olRDwbi
The Russian ambassador says that "important verbal agreements" were reached at the Helsinki summit.  What are those commitments, Mr. President? Congress needs to know.
Speaking on Senate floor in just a couple of minutes on bipartisan resolution regarding Helsinki Summit

This article answers the question most of us had when the “deal” for the EU to buy soybeans was announced. Who is the buyer?  The EU can’t force private companies in member countries to buy US soybeans.  https://t.co/9cu73DeCU1 https://t.co/p2GHiiH8z8
Good to be back in Zimbabwe. We have a good team here. https://t.co/nySFErqFJI
Sunset this evening in rural Zimbabwe. Tomorrow, election day, marks a new day for this beautiful country. https://t.co/rFNRCf1llw
Visited nearly a dozen polling places today in a very rural part of Zimbabwe. Much excitement everywhere. Polls close in less than two hours. https://t.co/jhOQDMQWmE
Here’s the polling station where I’ll be observing the counting of votes tonight. Polls close in less than 30 minutes. https://t.co/dBYMa7woko
Counting ballots in a tent in rural Zimbabwe by kerosine and candlelight. Democracy doesn’t get any better than this. https://t.co/Wb97dmJXdn

Honored to meet with both major presidential candidates Emmerson Mnangagwa and Nelson Chamisa this morning. We look forward to the results being announced and continued progress toward a democratic and prosperous future for Zimbabwe https://t.co/4OEo4mtEA1
All parties in Zimbabwe need to call for calm as election results are announced. The people of Zimbabwe have endured enough. It’s time for a new era of peace and prosperity.
Some thoughts on the Zimbabwe elections https://t.co/aS2kKLFLuk

There's a danger in conducting foreign policy by tweet after viewing a single press report. First, land reforms have been proposed in parliament in South Africa, but not yet adopted. Second, there is no "large scale killing of farmers" going on in South Africa. https://t.co/lpdyNIEH7V
God bless and keep this wonderful man and his family @SenJohnMcCain

Words cannot express the sorrow I feel at John McCain’s passing. The world has lost a hero and a statesman. Cindy and the McCain family have lost a loving husband and father. I have lost a wonderful friend.
My thoughts on the passing of Senator John McCain https://t.co/2Jw6piFm4O

Governor Ducey has selected Senator Jon Kyl as Senator McCain’s replacement. What an excellent choice! There is no one more qualified and Arizona is well served. Kudos to Senator Kyl for his willingness to serve once again.
So happy to have Senator Kyl back in familiar surroundings. https://t.co/ym0dGapGQl
Remembering those who lost their lives on 9/11, and those who have given their all to keep us safe ever since.

Speaking on the senate floor momentarily on the importance of AG Jeff Sessions holding his job and continuing to assert independence when the President asks him to protect his friends and go after his enemies

When Dr. Ford came forward, I said that her voice should be heard and asked the Judiciary Committee to delay its vote on Judge Kavanaugh. It did so. I now implore Dr. Ford to accept the invitation for Monday, in a public or private setting. The committee should hear her voice.
This is sickening. No one should make light of this situation. https://t.co/G7rlT3IKTQ

A TV Marti program that was introduced with the phrase, “George Soros, a multimillionaire Jew,” was paid for by the American taxpayer, and broadcast to Latin America last summer, in our name. This is taxpayer-funded anti-semitism.

TV Marti director says its program on George Soros lacked “balance.” Sorry, there is no balance that makes anti-Semitism right. BBG must investigate how such programming was produced and and why it aired. https://t.co/Ia01yuiKcB

I sent the attached letter to @USAGMgov CEO @JohnLansing today and appreciate his prompt response to the matter: https://t.co/ojdv1RrRd0  I will follow this investigation closely. Anti-semitism can have no place in government. https://t.co/DfWmRIdy8J

Amidst it all, we visited in AZ tonight with  those who are caring for asylum seekers. I was told “Let the politicians do what they will, just let us be Jesus.”  Thank you, Elizabeth and Magdalena, for a lesson in charity. https://t.co/6OIdNEqknL
Post election thoughts  https://t.co/L0769vqk7r

Earlier this year, we passed S.2644, the Special Counsel Independence and Integrity Act, out of the Senate Judiciary Committee. The bill would safeguard Robert Mueller’s investigation. Leader McConnell should bring the bill to the Senate floor as soon as possible
Jeff Sessions did the right thing by recusing himself nearly two years ago. He has paid a heavy price for his independence ever since. We owe him a debt of gratitude.

When the Senate convenes next week, @ChrisCoons and I will ask for unanimous consent to bring S.2644, the Special Counsel Independence and Integrity Act, to a vote on the Senate floor. After the firing of The AG, it is more important than ever to protect the Special Counsel.

There is no evidence of "electoral corruption" in Arizona, Mr. President. Thousands of dedicated Arizonans work in a non-partisan fashion every election cycle to ensure that every vote is counted. We appreciate their service. https://t.co/Xtd5Vd0gSu
There is no evidence of election officials "cooking the books" in Arizona. Such careless language undermines confidence in our democratic institutions. https://t.co/cNjYp0yIa1
Congratulations to @kyrstensinema on a race well run, and won. It’s been a wonderful honor representing Arizona in the Senate. You’ll be great.
What a gracious concession speech, @MarthaMcSally. You've done Arizona proud. https://t.co/uZgSYkHdTp

I have informed the Majority Leader that I will not vote to advance any of the 21 judicial nominees pending in the Judiciary Committee, or vote to confirm the 32 judges awaiting action on the floor, until the Mueller protection bill is brought to the full Senate for a vote.
From my window this morning. Winter is coming. https://t.co/lXXN7TlZta
